biography_text: MALINOWSKI, Tomaz, a Representative from New Jersey; born in Slupsk, Poland, September 23, 1965; graduated from Princeton High School, Princeton, N.J., 1983; B.A., University of California, Berkley, Calif., 1987; Rhodes Scholar, M.Phil., Oxford University, Oxford England, 1991; staff, nonprofit organization; nonprofit executive; staff, United States Senator Daniel P. Moynihan of New York, 1988; staff, United States Department of State, 1994-1998; staff, National Security Council, 1998-2001; Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor, United States Department of State, 2014-2017; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixteenth Congress (January 3, 2019-present).
